title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S. I. No. 408 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Housing Assessment
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Housing Assessment 

(Amendment) (No. 3) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on 1 January 2023.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited social housing assessment (amendment) (no 3) regulation 2022 (2) regulation come operation 1 january 2023

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S. I. No. 408 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2. The Social Housing Assessment Regulations 2011 (S. I. No. 84 of
text_raw:
2. The Social Housing Assessment Regulations 2011 (S. I. No. 84 of 
2011) (as amended by the Social Housing Assessment (Amendment) 
Regulations (S. I. No. 136 of 2011)) are amended— 

(a) 

(b) 

in Regulation 19(1), by substituting “€40,000” for “€35,000”, 

in Regulation 20(1), by substituting “€35,000” for “€30,000”, 
and 

(c) 

in Regulation 21(1), by substituting “€30,000” for “€25,000”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

1 December, 2022. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 6th December, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [615] 3

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S. I. No. 408 of 2020)), hereby
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations amend Regulations 19(1), 20(1) and 21(1) of the Social 
Housing Assessment Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 84 of 2011) to increase by 
€5,000 each the 3 bands of maximum income limits for eligibility for social 
housing support across the State. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [615]
